params.requestReference: the keccak256 hash of the bidder and the fileReference or the address of the contentManager (see: getRequestReference)

newRequest(bytes32[],address,uint120,uin.details: if Request was active before, is expired and final payout is not yet done, final payout can be triggered by proposer here. The to-be-pinned file's size in bytes (rounded up) must be equal in size to param size.

params.contentManager: if not equal to 0 address, we use this address to manage content and funds. WARNING: contentManager MUST adhere to the contentManager ABI.
params.fileReference: the reference to the to-be-pinned file (when contentManager is not used) When called by a ContentManager is used, this fileReference can be a nonce (such that a contentManager smart-contract can be used to request pinning for multiple files)
params.period: the chosen period (seconds after which a Request can be cancelled and left-over money refunded).
params.provider: the provider from which is proposed to take a StorageOffer.
params.size: the size of the to-be-pinned file in bytes (rounded up).

setMaximumDuration(uint128).details: - maximumDuration must be smaller or equal to the longest period (NOT verified by smart-contract). - make sure that any period is never more than a maximumDuration as this can never be accepted and hence is pointless

params.maximumDuration: the maximum time (in seconds) for which a proposer can prepay. Prepaid bids can't be cancelled REF1.

setStorageCapacity(uint128).details: exercise caution with assigning additional capacity when capacity is already taken. It may happen that when a lot of capcity is available and we release already-taken capacity, capacity overflows. We explicitely allow this overflow to happen on the smart-contract level, because the worst thing that can happen is that the provider now has less storage available than planned (in which case he can top it up himself). However, take care of this in the client. REF_CAPACITY

setStorageOffer(uint128,uint128,uint64[].details: - Use this function when initiating a storage offer or when the users wants to change more than one parameter at once. TODO: gas price comparison. maximumDuration must be smaller or equal to the longest period (NOT verified by smart-contract). - Exercise caution with assigning additional capacity when capacity is already taken. It may happen that when a lot of capcity is available and we release already-taken capacity, capacity overflows. We explicitely allow this overflow to happen on the smart-contract level, because the worst thing that can happen is that the provider now has less storage available than planned (in which case he can top it up himself). However, take care of this in the client. REF_CAPACITY - maximumDuration must be smaller or equal to the longest period (NOT verified by smart-contract). - make sure that any period * prices does not cause an overflow, as this can never be accepted (REF_MAX_PRICE) and hence is pointless

params.capacity: the amount of bytes offered. If already active before and set to 0, existing contracts can't be prolonged / re-started, no new contracts can be started.
params.maximumDuration: the maximum time (in seconds) for which a proposer can prepay. Prepaid bids can't be cancelled REF1.
params.periods: the offered periods. Length must be equal to pricesForPeriods.
params.pricesForPeriods: the prices for the offered periods. Each entry at index corresponds to the same index at periods.

setStoragePrice(uint64[],uint64[]).details: - make sure that any period * prices does not cause an overflow, as this can never be accepted (REF_MAX_PRICE) and hence is pointless - maximumDuration must be smaller or equal to the longest period (NOT verified by smart-contract).

params.periods: the offered periods. Length must be equal to pricesForPeriods.
params.pricesForPeriods: the prices for the offered periods. Each entry at index corresponds to the same index at periods.

params.fileReference: the reference to the to-be-pinned file (when contentManager is not used) When called by a ContentManager is used, this fileReference can be a nonce (such that a contentManager smart-contract can be used to request pinning for multiple files)
params.fromContentManager: set to true if the caller is a contentManager
params.provider: the provider from which is proposed to take a StorageOffer.

params.fileReference: the reference to the to-be-pinned file (when contentManager is not used) When called by a ContentManager is used, this fileReference can be a nonce (such that a contentManager smart-contract can be used to request pinning for multiple files)
params.fromContentManager: set to true if the caller is a contentManager.
params.provider: the address of the provider of the StorageOffer.

topUpRequest(bytes32[],address,bool).details: any safeMath operations in this function don't cause a deadlock, as a possible revert just means we can't prolong the request for the desired duration\

params.fileReference: the reference to the to-be-pinned file (when contentManager is not used) When called by a ContentManager is used, this fileReference can be a nonce (such that a contentManager smart-contract can be used to request pinning for multiple files)
params.fromContentManager: set to true if the caller is a contentManager.
params.provider: the address of the provider of the StorageOffer.

withdrawEarnings(bytes32[]).details: any safeMath operations in this function don't cause a deadlock, as a possible revert just means we have to add less requestReferences

params.requestReferences: reference to one or more Requests

acceptRequest(bytes32).notice: accepts a request. From now on, the provider is responsible for pinning the file

newRequest(bytes32[],address,uint120,uin.notice: request to fill a storageOffer. After requesting, an offer must be accepted by provider to become active.

setMaximumDuration(uint128).notice: set the maximumDuration for a StorageOffer.

setStorageCapacity(uint128).notice: set the capacity of a StorageOffer. If already active before and set to 0, existing contracts can't be prolonged / re-started, no new contracts can be started.

setStorageOffer(uint128,uint128,uint64[].notice: set the capacity, maximumDuration and price of a StorageOffer.

setStoragePrice(uint64[],uint64[]).notice: set the price for a StorageOffer.

stopRequestBefore(bytes32[],address,bool.notice: stops a Request before it is accepted and transfers all money paid in.

topUpRequest(bytes32[],address,bool).notice: extend the duration of the request.

withdrawEarnings(bytes32[]).notice: withdraws the to-withdraw balance of one or more Requests

userdoc.notice: Storage providers can offer their storage space and list their price and clients can take these offers
